description.narrative: A strengthened enabling environment and accountability structure within line ministries exists to support WASH at all levels, including the delivery of adequate, equitable and affordable WASH services.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Somalia Support Centre (USSC) P.O. Box 44145 - 00100 Nairobi

sector.narrative: Policy dialogue and advocacy on decentralization coordination and implementation
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

title.narrative: Somalia Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Water Sanitation and Hygiene)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 Somalia: Real time evaluation of UNICEF SCO humanitarian response to the pre-famine crisis
2019 Somalia: Final Evaluation of SIDA-funded project “Improving Children’s Access to Water and Sanitation in Somalia”
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A strengthened enabling environment and accountability structure within line ministries exists to support WASH at all levels, including the delivery of adequate, equitable and affordable WASH services.

description.narrative: To enhance government ownership, progress was made in the engagement of key ministries in policy/strategy formulation, sector coordination, knowledge management and development of sustainable WASH interventions. Government-led sector coordination is active in the northern regions while the cluster is active in the Central South regions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: National strategy to eliminate open defecation available with a systemic approach to gender

baseline.value: Existing protocols and decree issued by line ministries at subnational strategies

target.value: 2020:National strategy to eliminate open defecation available and implemented

actual.value: 2019:A consultant being hired through MoEWR for Work on water information system ongoing with government

title.narrative: Existence of functioning sector coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene

target.value: 2020:Sector/cluster coordination mechanism operational under Government leadership

actual.value: 2019:WASH cluster coordination is supported as well as monitoring and supervision

title.narrative: Existence and implementation of national water, sanitation and hygiene sector policy and strategy

target.value: 2020:Existing Sector policy and strategy funded and implemented informed by evidence; clear role and responsible of lead sector ministries, accountability mechanism exist, and innovation and initiatives to reduce disparities promoted

actual.value: 2019:Policy, strategic plan and M&E framework developed and submitted for Cabin approval

title.narrative: National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available

target.value: 2020:National systems integrated with FSNAU, SWALIM and REACH regular assessments and reporting mechanisms available

actual.value: 2019:A consultant being hired through MoEWR for Work on water information system ongoing with government
